intro: Rosa gallica var. reinechei, commonly known as the French pink or Reine des prés, is a cultivar of the Rosa gallica species. It is characterized by its vibrant pink flowers that bloom in clusters, typically in late spring to early summer. The plant is a deciduous shrub with thorny stems and dark green, serrated leaves. It is native to Europe and thrives in well-drained soil and full sun. This variety is valued for its ornamental beauty and historical use in gardens and floral arrangements.
